Here are some popular book-related hashtags on Instagram that you can use to increase your reach and engagement:

**General Book-related Hashtags**

1. #bookstagram (34.5M+ posts)
2. #booklover (23.5M+ posts)
3. #books (18.5M+ posts)
4. #reading (14.5M+ posts)
5. #bookworm (12.5M+ posts)
6. #bookclub (7.5M+ posts)
7. #bookish (6.5M+ posts)
8. #bookaddict (5.5M+ posts)
9. #booknerd (5M+ posts)
10. #bibliophile (4.5M+ posts)

**Genre-specific Hashtags**

1. #fantasybooks (2.5M+ posts)
2. #romancebooks (2.3M+ posts)
3. #thrillerbooks (1.8M+ posts)
4. #mysterybooks (1.7M+ posts)
5. #sciencefiction (1.6M+ posts)
6. #horrorbooks (1.5M+ posts)
7. #nonfictionbooks (1.4M+ posts)
8. #memoir (1.3M+ posts)
9. #poetrybooks (1.2M+ posts)
10. #youngadultbooks (1.2M+ posts)

**Community and Challenge Hashtags**

1. #bookofthemonth (1.5M+ posts)
2. #readabook (1.3M+ posts)
3. #readingchallenge (1.2M+ posts)
4. #bookstagramchallenge (1.1M+ posts)
5. #bookphotography (1M+ posts)
6. #bookrecommendations (900k+ posts)
7. #bookreview (800k+ posts)
8. #bookquotes (700k+ posts)
9. #bookart (600k+ posts)
10. #bookshelfie (500k+ posts)

**Tips for Using Hashtags**

1. Use a mix of niche and broad hashtags to reach different audiences.
2. Limit your hashtags to 10-15 per post to avoid looking spammy.
3. Create a unique hashtag for your channel or community to encourage user-generated content.
4. Use relevant hashtags consistently to build your brand and attract new followers.
5. Monitor your analytics to see which hashtags perform well for your content and adjust your strategy accordingly.

Remember to keep your hashtags relevant to the content of your post, and don't overdo it. You can also create a list of hashtags and save them in a note or document for easy reference.

Good luck with your Instagram posts, and I hope these hashtags help you grow your audience!
